177.article_body: Turkish air strikes hit several towns across northern Syria late Saturday, US-backed Kurdish-led forces said. Turkey targeted areas controlled by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported. Syrian army troops and SDF fighters were reportedly among those killed. Ankara said it targeted bases from where militants staged attacks on Turkey.

178.title: Foreign investors buy Indian equities worth ₹30,385 cr in Nov so far
178.article_body: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) have invested a net sum of ₹30,385 crore in equities during November 1-18, according to data with the depositories. The total outflow by FPIs in equities in 2022 stands at ₹1.4 lakh crore. On the other hand, foreign investors have pulled out ₹422 crore from the debt market during the period under review.

179.title: Cong has no moral grounds after aligning with Narmada activist: PM Modi
179.article_body: PM Narendra Modi criticised the Bharat Jodo Yatra for including activist Medha Patkar, who "stalled" the Narmada dam project "for three decades". "The Narmada project was the only solution to quench the thirst of the arid region of Kutch and Kathiyawad," he said. PM Modi urged Gujarat citizens to ask Congress on what "moral grounds" they are "seeking votes".

180.title: 64-yr-old railway doctor out for cycling dies as 4-wheeler crushes him in UP
180.article_body: A 64-year-old doctor at North Eastern Railway (NER) hospital was killed after a speeding four-wheeler crushed him near the 1090 crossing when he was out cycling. Police said that the deceased was a fitness enthusiast. The driver of the four-wheeler ran away from the scene. Some commuters informed the police about him.

181.title: 4 coal thieves killed, 2 injured in gunfight with CISF personnel in J’khand
181.article_body: At least four coal thieves were killed while two got injured during a gunfight with CISF personnel in Jharkhand’s Dhanbad, police said on Sunday. "The on-duty CISF personnel tried to stop coal thieves, who gathered in large numbers. However, when they attacked the jawans, a gunfight erupted in retaliation," Dhanbad SP (Rural), Reeshma Ramesan, said.

182.title: Mangaluru auto blast accused's Mysuru home raided, bomb squad deployed in area
182.article_body: The rented Mysuru home of the main accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast incident was raided on Sunday, police said. According to reports, a bomb squad has been deployed for a combing operation in the area. DGP Praveen Sood said that the accused was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card.

183.title: Tree branch falls on car during Formula E trials in Hyderabad; video surfaces
183.article_body: An accident was averted on Saturday after branch of a tree fell on one of the cars during the trial runs for Formula E race in Hyderabad. The incident occurred near Hyderabad's Prasads IMAX. The video of the incident went viral in which the branch can be seen falling on the racing car that lost control for a few seconds.

184.title: Bharat Jodo's positive energy undone by criticising Savarkar: Raut
184.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut said that the positive energy generated due to the Congress's Bharat Jodo Yatra has been undone by Rahul Gandhi's criticism of VD Savarkar. Raut questioned why Gandhi was giving the BJP a chance to divert attention from the yatra. He also questioned why Savarkar has not gotten the Bharat Ratna yet.

185.title: Nepal’s missing rare white-rumped vulture found in Bihar
185.article_body: A missing white-rumped vulture, being used by Nepal to monitor the population of the rare endangered species and the success of a breeding drive, was rescued in Bihar’s Darbhanga earlier this month, officials said. The male vulture with a satellite tag had gone off the radar since April and was last sighted in Nepal's Tanahun district in September.

186.title: Actor Naga Shaurya marries interior designer Anusha Shetty, pics surface
186.article_body: Actor Naga Shaurya got married to interior designer Anusha Shetty in Bengaluru after reportedly dating for around two years. Pictures of the couple from their wedding have surfaced online. Shaurya and Anusha's pre-wedding celebrations had taken place at a Bengaluru hotel on Saturday. A grand reception will reportedly take place in Hyderabad later.

187.title: Guess 'helped themselves to my artwork without asking,' says Banksy; shares post
187.article_body: Graffiti artist Banksy has accused Guess of using his work without permission. Banksy wrote on Instagram, "Attention...shoplifters. Please go to Guess on Regent Street. They've helped themselves to my artwork without asking, how can it be wrong for you to do the same to their clothes?" Guess said its collection was in collaboration with Brandalised, which licenses graffiti artists' designs.

188.title: Parveen Babi resented my stardom in Italy, shares Kabir Bedi
188.article_body: Kabir Bedi said that while he "didn't bother" about actress Parveen Babi's stardom in India, she had "resentment" towards his stardom in Italy. "She wasn't used to being second fiddle to me. Suddenly, I was the star and she wasn't. This also upset her," he shared. Bedi rose to fame (in Italy) with his series 'Sandokan', which aired in 1976.

189.title: Was reluctant to do Aashiqui, saw how Devdas beat woman: Anu Aggarwal
189.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal, known for her role in 'Aashiqui', said that she was reluctant to do the 1990 film at first. "I was put off by the way...women were depicted in Hindi movies, way back in the 90s," she stated. "Like we were shown 'Devdas'...I saw how Devdas beats up a woman when she refuses to marry him," she added.

190.title: Make sure BJP wins each & every polling booth in Guj: PM to voters
190.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Gujarat on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi urged the people to turn up in large numbers at their respective polling booths on the voting day and break all the previous records of voter turnout. "Another thing I want from you is to make sure the BJP wins each and every booth [in Gujarat]," PM Modi added.

191.title: 5 boys attack schoolgirl's father with iron rod in Pune; detained
191.article_body: Police have detained five minor boys for allegedly attacking the father of a girl student at a school with a sharp weapon and an iron rod in Pune's Lohegaon. The incident took place after the man approached and questioned the boys for allegedly passing comments and harassing people near the school. The victim suffered severe injuries in the incident.

192.title: Want to see how much this Ishan-Pant opening pair gets backed by team: Nehra
192.article_body: Former India pacer Ashish Nehra has said he wants to see how much the team management will back the opening pair of Ishan Kishan and Rishabh Pant in T20Is. The duo opened India's batting in the second T20I against New Zealand. "I want to see what [India] do with their opening options, main thing is...they cannot be confused," added Nehra.

193.title: I felt like a zombie: Joe Root on why he quit as England Test captain
193.article_body: England batter Joe Root opened up on his decision to step down as England's Test captain earlier this year, revealing that he almost felt like a "zombie" and wasn't able to enjoy time with his family. "The captaincy was starting to take a toll on me," said Root. "As soon as I [quit]...I [felt] so much better," he further said.

194.title: Night sky has been lit up by Surya: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 111*(51) vs NZ
194.article_body: Reacting to India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 51-ball 111* against New Zealand in second T20I, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "The night sky has been lit up by Surya! What a blinder." Mohammad Shami took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations for 111* (51)." It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. India won the match by 65 runs. Suryakumar was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

195.title: Priyanka silent on Shraddha murder case to keep 'vote banks' safe: UP Dy CM
195.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya criticised Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi for her silence on the Shraddha Walkar murder case, saying she is keeping her "vote banks" safe. "Congress' Priyanka Gandhi says 'beti hun lad sakti hun' but has not spoken a word on this incident. Why is she silent?" said Maurya.

196.title: Zepto reports ₹390 crore loss in first year of operations
196.article_body: Quick-commerce startup Zepto has reported a loss of ₹390.4 crore in the first year of its operations on a standalone basis. In FY22, Zepto generated a total revenue of ₹142.4 crore, according to regulatory filings. Founded by Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra in April 2021, the Mumbai-based soonicorn is currently valued at $900 million.

197.title: BJP should remove Koshyari from Maha Guv's post as he insulted Shivaji: Raut
197.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut criticised Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari for calling Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol' and said that BJP should apologise to everyone and remove Koshyari from the post. "The Governor has insulted Shivaji Maharaj four times in one year. Still, the government is silent," said Raut.

198.title: Big B's 'angry young man' inspired my 'Kantara' role: Rishab
198.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty has said he has been a fan of Amitabh Bachchan and added that he had watched several Bollywood films of the veteran actor. Speaking about his role in his film 'Kantara', Rishab added, "The 'angry young man' Amitabh was, that definitely was in Shiva (Rishab's character in 'Kantara')." Rishab has also directed and written 'Kantara'.

199.title: Mother Dairy hikes token milk price by ₹2/litre in Delhi-NCR
199.article_body: Mother Dairy has hiked the price of its token milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR citing a rise in input cost. The price of full-cream milk has been increased by ₹1 per litre. The latest hike in milk prices, the fourth this year by Mother Dairy, will come into effect on Monday, the company said.

200.title: My dear Bibing, stay young & fit always: Salman on Kiren Rijiju's b'day
200.article_body: Salman Khan took to Instagram to wish Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on his birthday. Sharing a picture with Rijiju, he wrote, "My dear Bibing, wishing you on your b'day abundance of love, health and happiness, stay young and fit always." On the work front, Salman will next be seen in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' and 'Tiger 3'.

201.title: Faulty signals under fire as 96 pedestrians die in Pune
201.article_body: In 2022, till October, there have been 96 pedestrian road crash deaths in Pune, according to Save Pune Traffic Movement (SPTM) which cited faulty pedestrian signals in the city as the reason behind these fatalities. Harshad Abhyankar, Director, SPTM, said that the PMC is not registering complaints. Shrinivas Kandul, head, PMC Electrical Department, said they will receive funds next month.

202.title: One of world's largest aircraft lands at Kolkata Airport; pics surface
202.article_body: One of the world’s largest aircraft Airbus Beluga made a landing at Kolkata Airport on Sunday for crew rest and refuelling. The Kolkata Airport authority shared pictures of the aircraft and wrote, "Guess who's back! It's the whale again!" This is the third time the aircraft visited Kolkata, the last being in May this year and before that in 1999.

203.title: COP27 ends in Egypt with decision to establish loss and damage fund
203.article_body: The UN Conference on Climate Change, COP27, concluded in Egypt on Sunday with a decision to establish a loss and damage fund to assist developing countries that are vulnerable to the adverse effects of climate change. "I welcome the decision to establish a loss and damage fund and to operationalise it in the coming period," UN Secretary-General António Guterres said.

204.title: Bankrupt FTX owes nearly $3.1 billion to its 50 biggest creditors
204.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion, revealed court filings. FTX, which filed for US bankruptcy court protection, said that it owes about $1.45 billion to its top ten creditors but didn't name them. On Saturday, FTX said that it is preparing for the sale or reorganisation of some businesses.

205.title: Former anti-abortion activist says key 2014 US SC ruling was leaked
205.article_body: A former anti-abortion activist has claimed he was informed in advance about the outcome of a 2014 US Supreme Court case involving contraceptives, The New York Times reported. Reverend Rob Schenck said he was tipped off about the pending ruling in the Burwell v. Hobby Lobby case shortly after two conservative allies had dinner at SC Justice Samuel Alito's home.

206.title: Had to leave 'Soldier' set for more than a week due to my exams: Preity
206.article_body: Preity Zinta in an Instagram post recalled shooting for her 1998 movie 'Soldier'. She said that she had to leave the set for more than a week while shooting for the climax scene due to her psychology exams. "Thank you Bobby (Deol) for being you & for bringing me into...movies & thank you to...entire...crew for so much fun," Preity added.

207.title: FIFA earns revenue of $7.5 bn for Qatar World Cup period
207.article_body: FIFA said that it has earned a revenue of $7.5 billion in the four years of commercial deals tied to the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Qatar Energy joined FIFA as a top-tier sponsor, and new third-tier sponsors include Qatari bank QNB and telecoms firm Ooredoo. FIFA also added financial platform Crypto.com and blockchain provider Algorand as second-tier sponsors.

208.title: 4 big cranes, 400 workers deployed for dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge
208.article_body: Four big cranes and 400 workers have been deployed for the dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge, reports said. The 27-hour mega block in the city in view of the dismantling began on Saturday night. Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the ongoing dismantling process. Meanwhile, reports said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces.

209.title: India record their biggest-ever T20I victory on New Zealand soil
209.article_body: India defeated New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. It's India's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20I cricket on New Zealand soil. The match witnessed Suryakumar Yadav smash 111*(51), his second hundred in T20Is. India have taken a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. The first match was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

210.title: 26-yr-old woman techie raped by man she met on matrimonial site in Pune
210.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, working for a multinational IT company in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, was allegedly raped by a man whom she met on a matrimonial website. She alleged that he raped her twice, promising that he would marry her and that they also held a pre-wedding tilak ceremony. The man has been identified as an IT engineer from UP's Prayagraj.

211.title: Faridabad policewoman arrested for receiving bribe to not book man for rape
211.article_body: Faridabad Police female constable was arrested for allegedly receiving a bribe from a man, who was booked for alleged dowry harassment, to not add rape sections to the FIR filed by his wife. The accused constable, Kalpana, had already received ₹20,000 from the man, Shabbir, and was demanding ₹15,000 more. Later, Kalpana was caught red-handed in a police laid-trap.

212.title: India break world record for playing most matches in a calendar year
212.article_body: Team India have broken the world record for playing the most number of matches in a calendar year. The second T20I against New Zealand on Sunday is India's 62nd international match in 2022. India overtook Australia, who had played 61 international matches in 2009. Further, it is India's 39th T20I match this year.

213.title: Didn't watch it but I'm sure it was another video game innings: Kohli on Suryakumar's 111*
213.article_body: Reacting to Suryakumar Yadav slamming 111*(51) against New Zealand in second T20I, Virat Kohli tweeted, "Numero Uno showing why he's the best in the world." He added, "Didn't watch it live...but I'm sure this was another video game innings by him." Suryakumar slammed 11 fours and seven sixes. Suryakumar is first Indian to slam a T20I hundred in New Zealand.

214.title: Rare bird spotted for the first time in 140 years on Fergusson Island; pic released
214.article_body: Scientists have 'rediscovered' the Black-naped Pheasant-Pigeon after spotting it some 140 years after its last sighting. The rare large, ground-dwelling pigeon, was photographed with a remote camera trap at the end of a month-long search of Fergusson Island in Papua New Guinea. Scientists hope the rare bird's rediscovery will provide a basis for its conservation.

215.title: Kajal reunites with Kamal Sadanah after 30 yrs for ‘Salaam Venky’
215.article_body: Bollywood actress Kajol will be seen sharing screen space with Kamal Sadanah after 30 years. Kajol and Kamal will be seen in Revathy's directorial venture 'Salaam Venky', which is set to release on December 9. Kajol and Kamal had earlier featured in the actress' Bollywood debut film 'Bekhudi' (1992). 'Salaam Venky' marks Kajol's first collaboration with Revathy.

216.title: Mahesh Bhatt, Denzongpa didn't object mention of Parveen Babi in my book: Kabir
216.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi has revealed that filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and actor Danny Denzongpa did not object to him writing about his and their relationships with late actress Parveen Babi in his autobiography. "What I wrote in the book is true and they (Mahesh and Danny) know it. There is nothing to hide here," he further added.

217.title: Veteran actor Amol Palekar, wife Sandhya join Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra
217.article_body: Veteran actor Amol Palekar and his wife writer-filmmaker Sandhya Gokhale joined Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra led by party leader Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra’s Buldhana district on Sunday. "Realising his responsibility towards the country, today famous actor and film director Amol Palekar along with his wife joined Bharat Jodo Yatra…Thank you for raising the voice of the country," Congress tweeted.

218.title: Deloitte says India likely to post 6.5-7.1% growth in current fiscal
218.article_body: India is expected to post an economic growth of 6.5-7.1% during the current financial year and 5.5-6.1% the following year amid rising inflation and global slowdown, a Deloitte India report said. The report said the upcoming festive season could boost the consumer sector. Credit growth in the industry and services sector has also risen remarkably, the report added.

219.title: Suspects barge into village house near Greater Noida, fire several gunshots
219.article_body: A few people entered a house in Anandpur village near Greater Noida on Friday and allegedly fired three rounds of bullets to threaten the residents. The complainant, Sumit, alleged that the suspects assaulted his brother and elderly parents. The six accused are residents of the same village and have had a dispute with the complainant's family since 2019, police said.

220.title: Uttarakhand CM runs, plays badminton with people in Almora; video surfaces
220.article_body: A video has surfaced in which Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami can be seen running and playing badminton with young sports enthusiasts in Almora this morning. "I ran and played badminton…During this, feedback was also taken from young colleagues and local people about the work being done by the government," said Dhami.

221.title: World no. 4 Ruud beats Rublev to reach maiden final at ATP Finals
221.article_body: World number four Casper Ruud reached the title match of ATP Finals for the first time after a 6-2, 6-4 win over sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev in Turin on Saturday. The 23-year-old Norwegian won his semi-final match in 69 minutes. Ruud will face five-time champion Novak Djokovic on Sunday. He is 0-3 in head-to-head against the Serbian.

222.title: Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus: Farooq Abdullah
222.article_body: Former J&K Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah warned people about political leaders who are attempting to create a religious divide in the valley, saying that Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus. "They will use 'Hindu khatre mai hain' a lot during the elections...but I request you not fall prey to it," said Abdullah.

223.title: Girl chased by 3 dogs in Ghaziabad, narrowly escapes; video surfaces
223.article_body: An 11-year-old girl narrowly escaped being bitten by three stray dogs in Ghaziabad. In a CCTV footage of the incident, the girl can be seen running towards her society as the dogs aggressively chase her. Later in the video, one of the dogs was seen jumping and grabbing the girl's t-shirt, however, she managed to escape and enter the society.

224.title: I had strong opinions on being benched for T20 WC match vs Afghanistan: Starc
224.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has revealed that he spoke to their chief selector George Bailey after being benched in their Super-12 stage match against Afghanistan in the recently concluded 2022 T20 World Cup. "I had strong opinions on it and had a conversation," said Starc. Australia had to defeat Afghanistan by a huge margin to qualify for the semi-finals.

225.title: Tim Southee becomes 2nd bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history
225.article_body: New Zealand pacer Tim Southee today became the second bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history. The 33-year-old dismissed Hardik Pandya, Deepak Hooda and Washington Sundar in India's last over in second T20I to take his second hat-trick in T20I cricket. Sri Lanka's Thisara Perera was the first bowler to take a T20I hat-trick against India.

226.title: We began with 2 people in 2018: Skyroot CEO after India's 1st private rocket launch
226.article_body: Pawan Kumar Chandana, the Co-founder and CEO of Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace, shared a picture with his Co-founder Naga Bharath Daka on Twitter, and said, "I'd like to take a moment to remember our 'Prarambh' with just two people in 2018." His remark came after the startup's successful Mission Prarambh, marking the launch of India's first privately built rocket.

227.title: Is free electricity your right or revdi?: Kejriwal during MCD polls campaign
227.article_body: Campaigning for the upcoming MCD polls, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked people not to vote for those who want to stop the city’s development and welfare work. "Is free electricity your right or revdi? They want to stop free electricity in Delhi. But don’t worry, as long as Kejriwal is alive, electricity will be free," he said while addressing people.

228.title: 9 prisoners escape from Nagaland jail, massive search operation launched
228.article_body: At least nine inmates of Mon district jail in Nagaland escaped from prison following which a massive search operation is underway to trace them, police said on Sunday. The prisoners include under-trial inmates and murder convicts. They managed to escape in the early hours of Saturday after somehow getting hold of their cell keys, a police officer said.

229.title: Isha Ambani, husband Anand Piramal blessed with twins
229.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani and her husband Anand Piramal have been blessed with twins on Saturday, according to an official statement released by the Piramal and Ambani families. The statement further said that Isha and the babies, baby girl Aadiya and baby boy Krishna are doing well.

230.title: I've been dealing with different social issues through films: Ayushmann
230.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who is UNICEF India's celebrity advocate, said he believes in cinema for change. Speaking about what motivated him to join UNICEF, he said, "I'm proud of my filmography as well as I've been dealing with different social issues through...entertainment." He added, "But, if I can do something outside the realm of cinema for the children, that's great."

231.title: Robotic surgery used to operate on 18-yr-old with ovarian cysts in Mohali
231.article_body: A Chandigarh-based 18-year-old girl, who had ovarian cysts, was operated on through a robotic surgery in Mohali. Dr Swapna Misra, Director of the Obstetrics and Gynaecology Department, said that so far, ovary removal was the standardised treatment for women having cysts around their ovaries. However, robotic surgery was used to preserve the young patient's organs.

232.title: When lawyers strike, consumers of justice suffer: CJI amid protest in Guj
232.article_body: Even as the Gujarat High Court Advocates' Association is protesting the transfer of Justice Nikhil S Kariel to Patna, CJI DY Chandrachud said people suffer when lawyers strike. "When lawyers strike, the greatest sufferers are not the lawyers themselves, or the judges, but the consumers of justice, for whom the lawyers exist in the first place," he said.

233.title: There is nothing from Pant's side, Urvashi just wants someone to tease her: Shubman Gill
233.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant-Urvashi Rautela controversy, Team India batter Shubman Gill stated that Pant doesn't get distracted by it. "There is nothing from Pant's side. Urvashi just wants someone to tease her," Gill stated. "He does not even care about it," Gill added referring to Urvashi's apparent social media posts on Rishabh Pant.

234.title: Why is 2022 FIFA World Cup official match ball named 'Al Rihla'?
234.article_body: The official match ball for 2022 FIFA World Cup is named 'Al Rihla'. It's inspired by culture, architecture, iconic boats and flag of Qatar, FIFA said. 'Al Rihla' in Arabic means 'the journey'. The bold, vibrant colours set on pearlescent background represent Qatar. 'Al Rihla' travels faster in flight than any other ball in FIFA World Cup history, FIFA stated.

235.title: Left home to go to Kashmir at 13, police brought me home: Deepti Naval
235.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval shared that at the age of 13, when she used to live in Amritsar, she decided to "leave home and live in Kashmir". "I was going to take a bus to Jammu...But I got caught at Pathankot. The police brought me back to my parents," Deepti said. She added, "A complaint was also lodged back in Amritsar."

236.title: Hyderabad Police to launch special campaign against wrong-side driving
236.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will undertake a week-long awareness drive from tomorrow (November 21) and will launch a special campaign on November 28 against wrong-side driving and tripling on motorcycles by imposing hefty fines. Those violating the wrong-side driving rule will now have to pay a fine of ₹1,700 against the current penalty of ₹1,100, the police said.

237.title: Pujara receives Arjuna Award 5 years after recommendation, shares pic
237.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara collected his Arjuna Award on Saturday, five years after he was recommended for the honour in 2017. Pujara took to Twitter to share pictures from the ceremony and wrote, "Thankful to BCCI and Anurag Thakur to organise and handover the Arjuna Award belatedly, which I couldn't collect the year it was awarded...due to my cricket commitments."

238.title: Musk holds 'code review' meeting with Twitter engineers till 1:30 am
238.article_body: Elon Musk held a 'code review' meeting with engineers at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters till 1:30 am. He also posted his pictures with the employees on Twitter. Responding to a tweet saying, "Twitter is more alive at 1 am than it used to be during the daytime," Musk responded, "The most people I've ever seen in the building by far."

239.title: If lawyers protest against collegium decisions, where will it lead?: Rijiju
239.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised protests by lawyers against the recommendations of the Supreme Court collegium to transfer some High Court judges. "If this becomes a recurring instance...taken by the collegium, on which it's being supported by...government, then where will it lead," he asked. Recently, bar bodies in Gujarat, Telangana and Madras have protested the transfer decisions.

240.title: Pune records season's coldest morning on Sunday, temperature drops to 9.7°C
240.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Pune city on Sunday reported the coldest morning of the season when the temperature dropped to 9.7 degrees Celsius. Pune was cooler than Mahabaleshwar, Lonavala and Matheran this morning. Mahabaleshwar reported night temperature of 10.9 degrees Celsius, Lonavala 12.5 degrees Celsius and Matheran 17.2 degrees Celsius.

241.title: 7 suspended after filing independent nominations after not getting BJP tickets
241.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party has suspended seven people who had filed independent nominations for seats where the party did not allot them tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The BJP leaders, including a sitting MLA and four former legislators, had filed nominations on Thursday as independents after being denied tickets by the party.

242.title: Mercedes-Benz to pay $5.5 mn to settle Arizona diesel ad case
242.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and auto supplier Robert Bosch have agreed to pay about $6 million to resolve a lawsuit accusing them of approving and marketing BlueTEC vehicles as "the most environmentally conscious diesel option" globally, the state of Arizona said. The firm will pay $2.8 million in consumer restitution. Each qualifying Arizona consumer will receive up to $625 per vehicle.

243.title: Pune City Police confiscates bar’s music system over noise pollution
243.article_body: The Pune City Police’s social security cell confiscated the music system and sound mixer, totalling ₹1.8 lakh, of Qora - Cocktail Bar and Kitchen in the Koregaon Park area for playing music beyond permissible noise levels. The action was taken under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000 and the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986, the cell said.

244.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes first Indian to slam a T20I hundred on New Zealand soil
244.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav today became the first-ever Indian batter to smash a T20I hundred on New Zealand soil. The 32-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries in second T20I against New Zealand at Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. He's the second Indian batter to score two T20I centuries in a calendar year after Rohit Sharma in 2018.

245.title: KDMC demolishes office of Uddhav-led Shiv Sena in Mumbai's Kalyan
245.article_body: The Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) demolished a public relations office of the Uddhav Thackeray-led faction of Shiv Sena after authorities declared it an illegal structure. KDMC claimed that it was constructed on a plot reserved for a playground. Several Shivsainiks protested against the action and said that the demolition was done under the pressure of Eknath Shinde-led government.

246.title: 7,500 people attend 1st day of Indian Racing League in Hyderabad
246.article_body: Nearly 7,500 people attended the first day of the two-day Indian Racing League on Saturday in Hyderabad. The league was flagged off by Telangana minister KTR. Twelve cars, six teams and four drivers participated in the race that was held on the 2.7 km-long Hyderabad Street Circuit. The Formula E race will be held in Hyderabad in February.

247.title: We've cracked sequel's premise: Vijayendra Prasad on 'RRR 2'
247.article_body: Days after director SS Rajamouli confirmed the sequel of 'RRR', his father and veteran writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has shared that the film's team has "cracked the sequel's premise". Earlier, during an event, Rajamouli had said that his father is "working on the story" of 'RRR 2'. The film ('RRR') starred Ram Charan and Jr NTR in the lead roles.

248.title: Elvis' biopic did him 'disservice', is 'inaccurate': Ex-girlfriend
248.article_body: Elvis Presley's ex-girlfriend Linda Thompson has said that the Baz Luhrmann's biopic film 'Elvis' has done a "disservice" to the late American music icon. She said the film has "many inaccurate and untrue elements," especially about the final years of Elvis' life. "Every time Elvis was hospitalised, I'd share his room...She (ex-wife Priscilla Presley) never even visited him," she shared.

249.title: Actress Aindrila Sharma passes away at 24
249.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma died on Sunday at a hospital in Kolkata, where she was undergoing treatment after suffering multiple cardiac arrests earlier this week. She was 24. Aindrila was admitted to the hospital on November 1 after suffering a brain stroke. She had an intracranial hemorrhage and had to undergo left frontotemporoparietal de-compressive craniotomy surgery.

250.title: No truth to this: Hrithik on report claiming he's moving in with Saba in ₹100-cr house
250.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to refute a report claiming that he will be moving into a new ₹100-crore apartment with his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad. Hrithik tweeted, "There is no truth to this. As a public figure, I understand I'll be under the lens of curiosity, but it's best if we keep misinformation away".

251.title: 3 including director, HR of NGO Chilume arrested for voter data theft
251.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested three people, including one of the founder-directors and human resource (HR) official of the NGO Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust, in connection with their investigation into alleged voter data theft in the city. The software developer, who allegedly created the 'Digital Sameeksha' app, was also reportedly taken into custody.

252.title: 3 transgenders selected as government school teachers in Karnataka
252.article_body: The Karnataka government has recruited three transgender teachers for state-run primary schools. "1% reservation was given in teacher recruitment for gender minorities. For the first time, three gender minorities have been selected," Education Minister BC Nagesh said. According to reports, a total of ten transgender people took the exam, out of which three were shortlisted.

253.title: Passenger was carrying explosives, had fake Aadhaar: Police on Mangaluru blast
253.article_body: In Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case, Karnataka Police has named the passenger as the prime suspect. DGP Praveen Sood said he was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card. "Since he...got 40% burns, we have to wait before we can interrogate him," Sood added. Meanwhile, Karnataka minister Araga Jnanendra said the terror link will be revealed soon.

254.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma visit temple in Uttarakhand; pic goes viral
254.article_body: Virat Kolhi and Anushka Sharma recently visited Nainital, Uttarakhand for a break with their one-year-old daughter Vamika. Anushka and Virat also sought blessings at the Neem Karoli Baba Ashram in Kainchi Dham. They were clicked with a few local fans in Nainital and the photos have gone viral on social media.

255.title: I don't see any reason for it: Donald Trump on whether he'll return to Twitter
255.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said, "I don't see any reason for it," when asked whether he planned to return to Twitter. He said he sees a "lot of problems" at Twitter and he will be staying on his own social media platform Truth Social. The comments came hours before Elon Musk reinstated Trump's Twitter account following a public poll.

256.title: Air India in talks with Boeing, Airbus to order new aircraft
256.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson has said the airline is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft. It aims to increase its market share to 30% on both domestic and international routes over the next five years. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes, expanding its fleet by more than 25%.

257.title: 78 foreign nationals deported for illegal stay in Pune in last 4 years
257.article_body: As many as 78 foreign nationals have been deported for illegal stay in Pune in last four years, according to the data provided by the Pune City Police. Some of them engaged in various unauthorised activities, the officials stated. According to the data, 42 foreign nationals were deported in 2019, 25 in 2020, three in 2021 and eight in 2022.

258.title: China reports 1st COVID-19 death in almost 6 months amid rising cases
258.article_body:
China on Sunday reported its first new death from COVID-19 in almost six months. The death of an 87-year-old Beijing man was the first reported by the National Health Commission since May 26. 
Due to rising cases in the country, lockdowns and strict restrictions have been put in place. On Saturday, China reported 24,263 new cases.

259.title: Counting of votes in Nepal elections to begin at 9 pm today
259.article_body: Nepal's Chief Election Commissioner Dinesh Kumar Thapaliya said the votes polled to elect a new Parliament and provincial Assemblies will be counted from 9 pm on Sunday. The voting will close at 5 pm and the ballot boxes would be collected by 7 pm. Collecting ballot boxes from mountainous districts would take time hence its counting will begin on Monday.

260.title: Twitter working on restoring Trump's previous followers: Elon Musk
260.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking for former President Donald Trump's previous followers to be restored, said, "Twitter engineering is working on it." The platform unbanned Trump's account on Sunday after Musk's poll saw 51.8% of over 15 million votes in favour of reinstatement. Trump's account reappeared on Twitter minutes after the poll ended.

261.title: Air India Mumbai-Calicut flight with 114 passengers delayed by 3 hrs
261.article_body: A Calicut-bound Air India flight from the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai was delayed by more than three hours on Sunday due to a technical issue, the airline said. There were 114 passengers on the flight. The aircraft came back at 6:25 am after push back at 6:13 am and finally departed at 9:50 am.

262.title: BJP’s criticism shows Bharat Jodo Yatra is a success: Cong
262.article_body: The Congress on Saturday said that criticism by the BJP of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra and Rahul Gandhi is a clear indication of the yatra’s success.“The BJP targeting the Bharat Jodo Yatra is a clear indication…it’s troubling them very much,” Congress leader KC Venugopal said. “Why should we be worried, let them criticise,” he added.

263.title: AAP protests against potholes in B'luru, demands action against officials
263.article_body: AAP leaders protested in Bengaluru over the issue of potholes and asked the government to take action against officials. They demanded that the civic body make a promise to the citizens to fix all the potholes within a week. The party also demanded a compensation of ₹25 lakh for each family that lost loved ones in accidents due to potholes.

264.title: I stopped getting roles when I got married, it caused me depression: Deepti Naval
264.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval has said she went through depression when she stopped getting offers after her marriage. She said, "It was as if my talent had been completely washed out...There were several years when I had no work. That was one of the things that caused me depression." Deepti married Prakash Jha in 1985, however, they got divorced in 2002.

265.title: Who are the past winners of FIFA World Cup?
265.article_body: Uruguay had won the first-ever FIFA World Cup in 1930. Brazil have won FIFA World Cup for the most number of times (five). The last five FIFA World Cups have been won by five different teams (France, Germany, Spain, Italy and Brazil). The 1958 final, which Brazil won 5-2 against Sweden, was the highest-scoring final in FIFA World Cup history.

266.title: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria booked for releasing '32 bore' song promoting gun culture
266.article_body: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria, producer Satta DK and owners of Love Music company have been booked in Ludhiana for releasing the song '32 bore' after the Punjab government banned songs glorifying weapons. Police said that the song was being shared on social media after its release on YouTube, and it glorifies weapons in the video as well as its lyrics.

267.title: Don't buy TV, fridge, car, hold on to your money: Bezos as he warns of recession
267.article_body: Amazon Founder and world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos urged people to consider not making large purchases as the "economy does not look good right now". In a recent interview, Bezos warned of a recession and asked American families to postpone purchase of items like big-screen TV, automobile, and refrigerator. "Hold onto your money, and see what transpires," the entrepreneur added.

268.title: Women, kids worked as whistleblowers for Swachh Bharat: Jal Shakti Minister
268.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that women and children worked like whistleblowers for the 'Swachh Bharat Mission'. "People's participation was most important for us and India owes its success to people who adopted this campaign relentlessly. It was women and children of the country, especially from small towns and villages, who became real change makers," Shekhawat said.

269.title: Flipkart denies posting job vacancy copied from Aus firm, says 'Our team didn't post this'
269.article_body: A job opening posted by Flipkart on LinkedIn appeared to have been copied from a similar vacancy shared by an Australian software company Atlassian. Replying to a LinkedIn user's post about the 'Head of Design' job opening, Flipkart said that no such role exists in the company and that no one from their recruitment team was involved in posting this.

270.title: Pregnant dog beaten to death, body dragged across field in Delhi; FIR filed
270.article_body: A pregnant dog was tortured to death by more than 25 students and staff members suspected to be of Don Bosco Technical Institute in South East Delhi, officials said. The video of the incident went viral in which the dog was seen being dragged across the field in the college compound. The New Friends Colony Police registered an FIR.

271.title: Electric meter tampering cases on rise in Pune
271.article_body: The number of meter tampering activities are on rise in Pune as Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) reported 5,719 cases of electricity theft and 1,591 cases of unauthorised use of electricity in the last 6 months. The electricity theft amounted to ₹16.07 crore while unauthorised use of electricity worth ₹6.43 crore was reported during this period.

272.title: Tabassum's last wish was to not inform about her death for at least 2 days: Govil
272.article_body: Tabassum's brother-in-law and actor Arun Govil shared that the veteran actress' last wish was to "not inform anyone about her demise for at least two days". "Her last rites were performed yesterday. She had a peaceful last journey," he shared. He informed that Tabassum, who passed away on Friday due to cardiac arrest, also suffered from some gastrointestinal problems.

273.title: Physiotherapists association condemns Sisodia's claim on Jain's massage video in jail
273.article_body: The Indian Association of Physiotherapists has refuted Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's claim of "physiotherapy treatment" on the leaked video of Satyendar Jain getting a massage in Tihar Jail. "IAP strongly condemns the statement of the minister degrading physiotherapy...Shows the level of education and knowledge to them about our noble profession," the association said.

274.title: Bihar woman alleges 'love jihad', says 'Family forcing her to eat beef'
274.article_body: A Hindu woman, Julie, in Bihar has accused her husband of 'love jihad' and claimed that the man was pressuring her to convert to Islam. "One day I came to know...that he is Tauquir, not Raj Singh...His entire family…[is] forcing me to eat beef...He is threatening that he will kill my entire family," said Julie.

275.title: Thank you for coming into my life: Shehnaaz remembers Sidharth Shukla
275.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, who won an award at a recently held award function, remembered late actor Sidharth Shukla and thanked him for coming into her life. "You have invested so much in me that today I've reached here," she said in Hindi. The video of her speech at the award show went viral on social media platforms.

276.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against New Zealand
276.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. India's playing XI includes Ishan Kishan, Rishabh Pant, Shreyas Iyer, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar and Yuzvendra Chahal. The first T20I was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

277.title: India reports 492 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,489
277.article_body: India reported 492 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 556 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 6,489. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,574, according to the ministry.

278.title: Woman caught with cocaine worth ₹3.6 crore hidden in wheelchair tyres in US
278.article_body: A woman was arrested at JFK Airport in New York after she allegedly tried to smuggle 28 pounds of cocaine with an estimated value of $450,000 (₹3.6 crore) in the tyres of her wheelchair. Customs officials stopped the woman after they noticed the wheels of her wheelchair weren't spinning properly. A Dominican national, she now faces federal narcotics smuggling charges.

279.title: Musk made it clear he'll be calling the shots: Twitter ex-executive on why he quit
279.article_body: Twitter's former Head of Safety and Trust Yoel Roth penned an article explaining reasons for his departure. He wrote that he ultimately left Twitter because Elon Musk "made clear that at the end of the day, he'll be the one calling the shots". "A Twitter whose policies are defined by edict has little need for...trust and safety function," he added.

280.title: Those who defame Gujarat should not find place in state: PM Modi
280.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally in Gujarat’s Valsad district on Saturday, appealed to people to be wary of those who defame Gujarat and said they should not find a place in the state. "We can never accept those who try to take Gujarat in reverse gear...They are trying to defame Gujarat and Gujaratis," PM Modi added.

281.title: One of India's most-wanted terrorist Rinda died of drug overdose in Pak: Reports
281.article_body: Harvinder Singh Sandhu alias Rinda, a most-wanted terrorist carrying a reward of ₹10 lakh, has reportedly died at a hospital in Lahore. Rinda, who was under the protection of Pakistan's ISI, was reportedly being treated for a kidney ailment triggered by drug overdose. Rinda was the mastermind behind the RPG attack on Punjab Police's Intelligence headquarters at Mohali this year.

282.title: Car catches fire in parking lot of Hyderabad Airport, driver jumps out
282.article_body: A fire broke out in a car when it reached the parking area of Hyderabad Airport, reports said. The car caught fire when the driver was about to park it in the parking area of the airport. The driver reportedly jumped out of car when he realised it was on fire. Some other vehicles near the car also caught fire.

283.title: Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom: Sunak in Ukraine
283.article_body: On his maiden visit to Ukraine after assuming office, UK PM Rishi Sunak said Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom. "We are with you all the way Volodymyr Zelenskyy," he tweeted, expressing UK's support for Ukraine in war against Russia. Thanking Sunak, Zelenskyy tweeted, "With friends like you by our side, we are confident in our victory."

284.title: PM Modi visits Somnath Temple on trip to Gujarat, pics surface
284.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday visited the Somnath Temple in Gujarat and offered prayers to the Aadi Jyotirling. Notably, PM Modi is also the Chairman of the temple's trust. He is scheduled to visit the Saurashtra region and will address rallies in  Veraval, Dhoraji, Amreli and Botad. On Monday, he will address rallies in Surendranagar, Bharuch and Navsari.

285.title: We are underestimating Elon Musk's genius: Harsh Goenka
285.article_body: Businessman Harsh Goenka said people are "underestimating the genius of Elon Musk". Stating that there must be "a method to his madness", Goenka noted that Musk was ahead of his time with his other companies like Tesla, SpaceX and The Boring Company. "He surely has a game plan with Twitter...Let's give him time before we predict its death," Goenka tweeted.

286.title: Cong against development: Vijay Rupani on Patkar joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
286.article_body: After activist Medha Patkar joined 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra, former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that Patkar's participation in the Congress' 'padayatra' shows that the party is against development. "Medha Patkar was the person who opposed [the] Narmada dam project. She protested over it and created obstacles in the state's development," said Rupani.

287.title: Athiya-KL Rahul's wedding will happen very soon: Suniel Shetty
287.article_body: Suniel Shetty has confirmed his daughter and actress Athiya Shetty will soon marry cricketer KL Rahul. At the Dharavi Bank launch event, reporters asked Suniel Shetty when Athiya Shetty would be getting married to KL Rahul, to which the actor answered, "Jaldi hogi". The couple has reportedly been in relationship for the past three years.

288.title: Cisco to lay off over 4,000 employees in a 'rebalancing' move: Report
288.article_body: Cisco is reportedly laying off over 4,000 employees, or about 5% of its workforce. According to a report, while Cisco CEO termed it as "rightsizing certain businesses", CFO Scott Herren said, "Don't think of this as a headcount action that is motivated by cost savings. This really is a rebalancing." Recently, Twitter, Meta and Amazon had announced job cuts.

289.title: John Abraham to star in Abhishek Sharma's science-fiction film Parlok
289.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma has confirmed that he is teaming up with John Abraham for his upcoming film, titled 'Parlok', which will be a "science-fiction film". "It's a fantastic story we both want to tell...this is going to be a new world for me to explore as a director," Sharma said, adding that John will also produce the film.

290.title: Bihar CM to be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil job promise: Prashant Kishor
290.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil his promise of providing "10 lakh government jobs" to the youth of Bihar in the coming days. "The CM, during his Independence Day speech...had promised that the grand alliance government aimed at providing jobs to 10 lakh people in government sector," Kishor added.

291.title: B'luru Police issues advisory banning heavy vehicles near Hebbal flyover
291.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police announced a ban on heavy vehicles between the Sadahalli toll gate and the Hebbal junction to facilitate ease of commute between the Bengaluru International Airport and the city during peak hours. The ban will be effective between 8.30 am and 10.30 am every day, according to the order issued by new Bengaluru Traffic Special Commissioner.

292.title: Nepal to sell 5 Chinese planes over breakdowns, lack of pilots: Report
292.article_body: State-owned Nepal Airlines has decided to sell five Chinese planes due to breakdowns and a lack of pilots, a report said. In September, the three 17-seater and two 56-seater aircraft were put for lease for bidders. The deadline of October 31 was extended to November 16 but Nepal Airlines didn't get a single bid even after the extension.

293.title: 7 people try getting on 2-wheeler; Delhi police share video, say 'Only for 2'
293.article_body: Delhi Police shared a video of seven people trying to get on one two-wheeler. "Lest the world of happiness gets ruined...Two-wheelers are only...for two people," police wrote. In the video, a woman can be seen making a child sit on a bike while two people are already on it. Two children and two women can be seen waiting.

294.title: Staff leaving Twitter after Musk's mail share pics of laptops with blue bird stickers
294.article_body: Several employees who chose to quit after Elon Musk's mail about the company's "hardcore culture", tweeted photos of their laptops with blue bird stickers and memorabilia. A former employee also tweeted, "I may be exceptional but...I’m just not hardcore." In the email, Musk had asked staff to commit to a "new Twitter" or leave with three months of severance pay.

295.title: Madras HC prevents 12,000 websites from streaming FIFA WC illegally
295.article_body: The Madras High Court on Friday restrained over 12,000 websites from streaming the FIFA World Cup 2022 illegally. Justice M Sundar granted the injunction while passing interim orders on an application arising out of a civil suit filed by Viacom 18. Viacom 18 said it has transmission rights for Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

296.title: Act of terror, not accidental: K'taka DGP on autorickshaw blast in Mangaluru
296.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood said on Sunday that the explosion in an autorickshaw in Mangaluru was not accidental but an act of terror. The intention was to cause serious damage, he added. "Karnataka State Police is probing deep into it along with central agencies," Sood tweeted. The autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded.

297.title: Retired professor cheated of ₹20 lakh by cyber fraudsters in Pune
297.article_body: A 74-year-old retired professor was cheated of ₹20 lakh in an online fraud in Pune. "On the pretext of helping the senior citizen to complete her KYC update, the fraudster tricked the complainant into giving her debit card details, including the CVV number," said a police officer. The accused also hacked her mobile phone by making her download an application.

298.title: Waymo gets permit to offer driverless test rides in California
298.article_body: Alphabet's self-driving vehicles unit Waymo has received California Public Utilities Commission's permit to participate in a driverless pilot programme. Under the programme, passengers will be able to ride in test autonomous vehicles operating without a driver. With this permit, Waymo may offer driverless passenger service throughout San Francisco and portions of Palo Alto, among other cities.

299.title: Split coaching after 2023 ODI WC has high plausibility: Dinesh Karthik
299.article_body: With Ravi Shastri criticising India head coach Rahul Dravid for taking a break for the New Zealand tour, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said that "split coaching" could be the way forward, considering the amount of cricket being played. "It's something which India needs to look into after the 2023 ODI World Cup when the contract is up for renewal," stated Karthik.

300.title: Son of retired constable cheats people in Thane wearing fake uniform, arrested
300.article_body: A 41-year-old man was arrested in Thane for wearing fake police officer's uniform and cheating people. The accused, son of a retired police constable, wanted to become a police officer but failed to do so. He would stop cars and extort money for any violations. He also cheated a woman who fell in love with him believing his fake identity.

301.title: Ballon d'Or winner Karim Benzema ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup
301.article_body: France striker Karim Benzema, who won the Ballon d'Or award this year, has been ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar after tearing a muscle in his left thigh during training on Saturday. It will now be the first time since 1978 that the reigning Ballon d'Or winner will not feature in the World Cup.

302.title: Such crimes committed due to access to material on internet: Bombay HC CJ on Shraddha case
302.article_body: Referring to Mumbai woman Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, Bombay High Court Chief Justice Dipankar Datta said, "All these crimes are being committed because there is so much access to the material on the internet." He added, "The Indian Telecommunication bill is there and we require certain robust legislation to tackle all the situations."

303.title: Couldn't prevent my son from committing suicide, felt guilty: Kabir Bedi
303.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi said he feels guilty that he couldn't prevent his son Siddharth Bedi "from committing suicide". Siddharth took his own life in 1997, at the age of 25, after being diagnosed with schizophrenia. Kabir also spoke about the time when he went through financial disasters and suffered great losses due to bad investments.

304.title: Judges at grassroots reluctant to grant bail due to fear of being targeted: CJI
304.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud on Saturday said judges at the grassroots are reluctant to grant bail due to the sense of fear of being targeted for granting bail in heinous cases. "The higher judiciary is flooded with bail applications due to reluctance at grassroots to grant bail," CJI Chandrachud said at a felicitation event organised by the Bar Council of India.

305.title: Dismantling of Carnac Bridge starts in Mumbai, Central Railway shares video
305.article_body: The dismantling of Carnac Bridge has started in Mumbai. The Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the process. "Dawn of the day. Dismantling in progress," the Central Railway wrote. A Central Railway official said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces using gas cutters and gas cylinders in a 27-hour operation.

306.title: Don't be swayed by what Musk's selling, it doesn't fit your type: Ashneer to founders
306.article_body: Addressing the mass layoffs taking place globally, 'Shark Tank India' investor Ashneer Grover urged startup founders not to get "swayed by what Elon Musk is selling as couture" as "it does not fit your body type". He suggested that founders should reduce salaries by 25% rather than conducting mass layoffs. "It's a better solution as rehiring will be...costly," Grover added.

307.title: People with no contribution to country shouldn't question Savarkar: Assam CM
307.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against VD Savarkar and said that people who have made no contribution to the country should not question freedom fighters. "Savarkar spent many years in jail…It is a sin to question Savarkar's contribution. Rahul Gandhi should not [commit] this sin," said Sarma.

308.title: Court says Mumbai driver applied brakes due to speed breaker in 9-yr-old case
308.article_body: A magistrate court has acquitted an auto driver in a nine-year-old rash driving case, alleging that he applied brakes to avert an accident after he saw an unmarked speed breaker 10 feet away. A mother and son travelling in his auto had sustained injuries when it skid and fell on its side. A complaint had been registered.

309.title: 2 arrested for posing as GST officials, cheat people of ₹28 cr in Hyd
309.article_body: The Cyberabad Special Operations Team arrested two persons, posing as GST officials, for allegedly cheating 18 persons to the tune of ₹28 crore. They approached people, saying they could help them get gold and other expensive items seized by the customs department at lower prices. DCP (Balanagar), G Sandeep, said they would collect huge amounts from the victims and escape.

310.title: It wasn't poor bowling from India, just a chasable target: Hales on T20 WC semis
310.article_body: England batter Alex Hales, on being asked about their 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final match, said  India were "30 runs short" in the match. "Chasing a total of 160 or 170 is a little bit easy at Adelaide...I don't necessarily think it was poor bowling from India," added Hales. England chased down India's 169-run target without losing a single wicket.

311.title: Pay disparity exists because of 'insecurity of a man': Jaya Bachchan
311.article_body: Actress-politician Jaya Bachchan said that the pay disparity, which exists in every field, "is an outcome" of men's "insecurity". "He's (man is) insecure, which is why he feels it's easier to put a woman down...in every way," she mentioned. Shweta Bachchan said the issue (of pay parity) needs to be addressed as women are "making an equal impact as men".

312.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face 12-hr water cut tomorrow
312.article_body: Parts of South Bengaluru will be facing water supply disruptions tomorrow (November 21) from 6 am to 6 pm. The water supply will be stopped to carry out work on shifting supply lines of various diameters near Metro construction sites laid by BWSSB (Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board) from KR Puram to Silk Board along the Outer Ring Road.

313.title: China urging military veterans to work at iPhone factory to boost production: Reports
313.article_body: Chinese government officials are reportedly urging retired military staff to help boost production at the Apple iPhone maker Foxconn’s factory in Zhengzhou as its production got hit by COVID-19-related restrictions. A Veteran Affairs Bureau of the People's Liberation Army in the plant's province said veterans were always under Communist Party's command and should "show up where there's a need".

314.title: BJP's top leaders to hold 14 roadshows for MCD polls in Delhi today
314.article_body: Ahead of MCD polls in Delhi, BJP has planned 14 roadshows led by several top leaders today to woo voters. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, BJP chief JP Nadda, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, Haryana CM ML Khattar, Union MoS Jitendra Singh and MoS Meenakashi Lekhi are among the ones enlisted for the campaign.

315.title: Bengal man barks at officer after ration card printed with surname 'Kutta', video goes viral
315.article_body: A man named Srikanti Kumar Dutta in West Bengal's Bankura district behaved like a dog by 'barking' at a local block development officer after his surname on the ration card was misspelt as 'Kutta' (dog) instead of 'Dutta'. A video of the incident has gone viral. Dutta said his name was misprinted thrice and he was mentally disturbed by this.

316.title: 45-yr-old Pune woman cycles 3,955 km from Koteshwar to Kibithoo in 13 days
316.article_body: A Pune-based 45-year-old woman, Preeti Maske, covered a distance of 3,955 km from the Indo-Pak border at Koteshwar to reach Kibithoo in Arunachal Pradesh on the Indo-Tibetan border on a cycle in 13 days, 19 hours and 12 minutes. Reports said that she completed her journey at 12:19 am on November 15. The 3,955 km long trip covered seven states.

317.title: Mumbai local train services hit due to 27-hr mega block for bridge demolition
317.article_body: Local train services in Mumbai will remain affected as the Central Railway (CR) has announced a 27-hour mega block from 11 pm on November 19 to 2 am on November 21 for the demolition work of British-era Carnac Bridge. The block will be operated for 17 hours on the Main line and for 21 hours on the Harbour line.

318.title: Biden's granddaughter Naomi marries Peter Neal at White House; pics surface
318.article_body: US President Joe Biden's granddaughter Naomi Biden and Peter Neal were married in a private ceremony at the White House on Saturday. The event marked the 19th wedding in the 200-plus years of White House history. "It has been a joy to watch Naomi grow...[and] carve out such an incredible life for herself," Biden and first lady Jill said.

319.title: Donald Trump's account reappears on Twitter 22 months after it was banned
319.article_body: Former President Donald Trump's Twitter account was visible again on Sunday, shortly after Elon Musk announced he would be reinstated on the platform. The @realDonaldTrump account, including its previous tweets, reappeared 22 months after it was permanently suspended due to risk of further incitement of violence. "The people have spoken," wrote Musk on the results of a personal Twitter poll.

320.title: 3 Humboldt penguins born in Byculla zoo in 7 months named Flash, Bingo, Alexa
320.article_body: Three Humboldt penguins who were born in Mumbai's Byculla Zoo in last seven months have been named Flash, Bingo and Alexa. Male chicks, Flash and Bingo, were born on April 2 and 26 respectively. Female chick, Alexa, was born on August 9. Penguins Donald and Daisy gave birth to Flash and Alexa, while Bingo was born to Molt and Flipper.

321.title: SpaceX to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander on Nov 28
321.article_body: SpaceX is scheduled to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander, part of the HAKUTO-R lunar exploration program, on November 28. Following landing, Hakuto-R's M1 will deploy a small United Arab Emirates rover, called Rashid. The firm has chosen the Atlas Crater at Mare Frigoris to the far north of the Moon as its primary landing site.

322.title: Elon Musk considers firing more Twitter employees: Report
322.article_body: Elon Musk is reportedly considering firing more Twitter employees as soon as Monday, days after hundreds of employees resigned by declining to accept the billionaire's ultimatum of an "extremely hardcore" culture. The new round of layoffs will likely target the sales and partnerships teams, Bloomberg reported. Musk has fired two executives who refused to fire more employees, the report said.

323.title: Amazon-owned Wickr Me messaging app to shut down next year
323.article_body: Amazon's AWS-owned Wickr Me messaging app will shut down on December 31, 2023. Wickr said the app will stop accepting new user registrations after December 31, 2022, before shutting down permanently next year. Earlier this year, a report suggested that Wickr Me had become "a go-to destination for people to exchange images of child sexual abuse".

324.title: Donald Trump will be reinstated on Twitter, confirms Elon Musk
324.article_body: Elon Musk confirmed on Sunday morning that former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account will be reinstated. The decision was announced after 51.8% of over 15 million users voted in favour of unbanning Trump's account on a poll held by Musk. "The people have spoken," Musk wrote. Trump's Twitter account was suspended after last year's attack on the US Capitol.

325.title: Messi-led Argentina staying at Qatar University instead of hotel due to barbecue: Reports
325.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina are staying at Qatar University instead of 5-star hotel so they can have their traditional beef barbecues during FIFA World Cup 2022, as per reports. "We visited...campus several times and chose it because not only does it have great facilities but it also has open-air space for Asados (Argentinian custom of barbecue)," an Argentina FA official said.

326.title: 5 injured in Russian strike on aid station: Ukrainian Prez's aide
326.article_body: Five people were injured in a Russian strike on a humanitarian station in southern Ukraine, Kyrylo Tymoshenko, a senior Ukrainian presidential aide, said on Saturday. He said the centre had been handing out bread. The attack took place in a town just west of the city of Kherson, which Ukrainian troops recaptured from Russian forces last week, Tymoshenko informed.

327.title: Bulgaria charges 5 people over blast in Turkey's Istanbul
327.article_body: Bulgaria has charged five people, including a woman of Syrian Kurdish origin, in connection with the blast in Turkey's Istanbul on Sunday that killed six people, prosecutors said. The suspects were detained earlier this week, Bulgaria's chief prosecutor Ivan Geshev said on Saturday. They have been charged with "supporting terrorist acts in another country" and "human trafficking", Geshev added.

328.title: Four-time champion Sebastian Vettel qualifies 9th for final F1 race
328.article_body: Aston Martin driver and four-time F1 world champion Sebastian Vettel qualified ninth for Sunday's 2022 season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "I'm still in the zone now, but I'm sure it will be a big day tomorrow," said Vettel, who retires after the race. Red Bull's Max Verstappen took the pole position, ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and Ferrari's Charles Leclerc.

329.title: UK PM Sunak pays surprise visit to Kyiv, announces defence package
329.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Saturday paid a surprise visit to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sunak also announced a fresh air defence package for Ukraine, which Britain valued at $60 million. Zelenskyy posted a video of the meeting online, where the two leaders are seen smiling and shaking hands before beginning discussions on the Russian invasion.

330.title: If I play well, no one can stop me from getting into hockey WC team: Sumit
330.article_body: Indian midfielder Sumit said that if he plays well then no one can stop him from getting into the national squad for the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in January. "The Australia tour is really important before the WC...Australia is a really strong team [and] we will get good competition from them," 25-year-old Sumit said.

331.title: Not interested in Ronaldo's form, he's hungry to score: Portugal manager
331.article_body: Portugal manager Fernando Santos said he is "not interested in" Cristiano Ronaldo's recent form and believes the forward is "hungry" to score goals. "He has always been hungry - that's why he has stayed at the top of the game for so long," said Santos. He added that Ronaldo has a "huge hunger" to "make Portugal the world champions".

332.title: We're keen to begin talks with India on trade in digital services: Aus minister
332.article_body: Australia is keen to begin discussions with India on trade in digital services under a Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement, Australia's Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs Tim Watts said. He added that Australia "believes digital trade is a really worthwhile agenda". Watts stated that the responsible ministers from both nations had committed to starting negotiations in coming months.

333.title: Indira Gandhi was fiercely committed to all-inclusive patriotism: Sonia
333.article_body: On the occasion of ex-PM Indira Gandhi's birth anniversary, Congress MP Sonia Gandhi said that the former was fiercely committed to "all-inclusive patriotism". Sonia said that even Indira's critics recognised the "unchanging core of her personality, that defined who she was and what she did". Notably, Sonia was speaking at the Indira Gandhi Peace Prize ceremony in New Delhi.

334.title: Malaysia's ex-PM Mahathir suffers 1st election defeat in 53 years
334.article_body: Malaysia's 97-year-old former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad suffered his first election loss in 53 years on Saturday. Mahathir failed to retain his Langkawi island constituency in the Parliamentary election. Mohd Suhaimi Abdullah from the Perikatan alliance won the Langkawi island seat. The Perikatan alliance is led by former prime minister Muhyiddin Yassin.

335.title: Early winter snowstorm claims 2 lives in US' New York state
335.article_body: Two persons have died in the US' New York state due to heavy snowing. The snowstorm was described as an early winter "lake effect" from Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, which dumped about 4 feet of snow on Friday, Reuters news agency reported. Officials said the deaths occurred due to heart attacks caused by overexertion while clearing snow.

336.title: Suspected Congolese soldier killed after crossing border: Rwanda
336.article_body: A man wearing a Congolese army uniform was shot dead by Rwandan troops on Saturday, Rwanda's military said. After crossing into the Rwandan side of the Rwanda-Congo border, the unidentified soldier started firing at Rwandan guard towers, following which he was neutralised, the military added. Congolese officials said that no soldier on duty in the area had been reported missing.

337.title: Congress to distribute 100,000 copies of Constitution in Maharashtra
337.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday launched a campaign to distribute 100,000 copies of the Indian Constitution to the people of Maharashtra under the 'Save Democracy' initiative. The programme has been taken up by the Maharashtra Congress Scheduled Caste Department, which is led by Siddharth Hattiambire. The leader said the Constitution is under severe threat owing to the BJP government.

338.title: RCB's first IPL title will lead to more titles quickly: De Villiers
338.article_body: Former South African batter AB de Villiers said if Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) win their first IPL title, they could win quite a few rather quickly. "I think if RCB wins one then they'll probably win two, three, four quickly...hopefully RCB's turn is around the corner," said de Villiers. He added that T20 cricket is a "bit of a gamble".

339.title: Student groups clash outside university campus in Punjab, 4 injured
339.article_body: Four students sustained injuries when two groups allegedly clashed outside CT University campus in Punjab's Ludhiana district during a convocation ceremony on Friday. The clash allegedly took place between current and former students over some comments on an Instagram post. Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan was the chief guest at the convocation.

340.title: Video shows girl students making chapatis in Punjab school; probe on
340.article_body: A video showing some girl students of a government school in Punjab making chapatis has gone viral on social media. The students were reportedly making chapatis for mid-day meal in school. The school is located in Pathankot's Sujanpur. The school's principal said that an investigation is being conducted into the incident.

341.title: Wimbledon to allow female players dress code exemption over period concerns
341.article_body: Wimbledon will allow female players to wear dark-coloured undershorts from next year to ease anxiety over playing during their period. Wimbledon chief executive Sally Bolton said, "We're committed to supporting players and listening to their feedback." She added, "It's our hope that this rule adjustment will help players focus purely on...performance by relieving a potential source of anxiety."

342.title: If not us, would want to see Messi or Suarez win FIFA WC: Spain coach
342.article_body: Spain coach Luis Enrique said if his team doesn't win the FIFA World Cup, then he would like to see Lionel Messi's Argentina or Luis Suarez's Uruguay crowned champions. He added that "it would be very unfair" for Messi to retire without a World Cup. Enrique added that Spain has guessed who they will face in the Round of 16.

343.title: 5-time champion Djokovic defeats Fritz to reach final of ATP Finals
343.article_body: Five-time champion Novak Djokovic beat American Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-5), 7-6(8-6) in the semi-final of the ATP Finals in Turin on Saturday. "I didn't feel very reactive today or very comfortable...I am very pleased to have overcome this one," said Djokovic. The Serbian won his last Red Group match against Daniil Medvedev in three hours and 11 minutes on Friday.

344.title: Beating higher-ranked players at Asian Cup was an achievement for me: Manika
344.article_body: Following Manika Batra's bronze medal win after beating world number six Hina Hayata at Asian Cup, the world number 44 said defeating higher-ranked players was an achievement for her. The 27-year-old became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal in the tournament. Manika beat world number seven Chen Xingtong in pre-quarterfinal. She defeated 23rd-ranked Chen Szu-Yu in quarter-final.

345.title: Rohit Shetty took 4 years to get script right: Vivek on 'Indian Police...'
345.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, speaking about his upcoming web series 'Indian Police Force', said it's loaded with Rohit Shetty's signature larger-than-life narrative but the director has also adopted a realistic approach for the show. He added Rohit took four years to get the script right. "The scale, the passion with which Rohit has made this...he'll set a benchmark with [it]," said Vivek.

346.title: Was overwhelmed: Nishikori on shedding a tear for Federer at Tokyo event
346.article_body: Explaining why he shed a tear after meeting Roger Federer at an event in Tokyo, 2014 US Open runner-up Kei Nishikori said, "I was overwhelmed by the atmosphere." "And also my admiration for him. After that I've started considering him an opponent to beat though he's my idol," he added. It was Federer's first exhibition match since retiring from tennis.

347.title: Your legacy will live forever: Tabassum's granddaughter on actress' death
347.article_body: Tabassum's granddaughter Karishma Govil took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering the late actress. "Rest in peace, dadiji. Your smile, tenacity and legacy will live forever," she wrote, sharing some old pictures with her grandmother. Tabassum, who hosted the celebrity talk show 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan', passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday.

348.title: 'Trace, Target, Terminate' policy needed for all economic crimes: Shah
348.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the strategy of 'Trace, Target and Terminate' needs to be adopted for every level of economic crime. He made the remarks while addressing the 'No Money for Terror' Ministerial Conference on Counter-Terrorism Financing. India has decided to develop national and global databases on narcotics and economic offences, and terrorism, Shah added.

349.title: 5, including 3 BSF personnel, arrested for gang-rape in Rajasthan
349.article_body: Five men were arrested for allegedly gang-raping a woman in Sri Ganganagar, Rajasthan. The accused include one head constable and two constables of the Border Security Force. "The 35-year-old victim...said that persons known to her took her to a place on the pretext of buying her ghee...The accused took her to a secluded place...[and] then raped her," an official said.

350.title: 8 men arrested for smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati
350.article_body: Police arrested eight men for allegedly smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. "[We have] seized 85 red sandalwood logs from three areas of Tirupati. Four two-wheelers and one goods carrier [have] also [been] seized," said Circle Inspector, Ramakrishna. He added, "Search [operation] launched for smugglers who absconded [and] a case [has been] registered."

351.title: 25-yr-old hoists Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at Mt Friendship peak
351.article_body: A 25-year-old man named Chaman Lal Kose hoisted the Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at the peak of Mount Friendship, Himachal Pradesh, on Wednesday. The Chhattisgarh resident also raised another flag dedicated to CM Bhupesh Baghel. Kose said scaling the peak wasn't easy and his expedition was hit by avalanches. The peak lies at a height of 17,353 feet above sea level.

352.title: Censor board asks 'Bhediya' producers to change abusive words to 'gadha', 'sansad' to 'body'
