352.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has asked the makers of 'Bhediya' to change certain abusive words in the movie to "gadha". It also asked the makers to replace 'Ganga Jamuna mix' with 'Ganga Jamuna juice'. It further asked them to change 'sansad' to 'body', 'PMO' to 'minister' and 'country' to 'logo'.

353.title: Brett Lee names his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, includes 4 Indians
353.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee has named his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, which includes four Indians. He included Alex Hales and Jos Buttler as openers, followed by Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav and Glenn Phillips. Other players in the team include Hardik Pandya, Shadab Khan, Sam Curran, Shaheen Afridi, Arshdeep Singh and Adil Rashid.

354.title: Prithvi Shaw is naturally destructive, simply flies: Aakash Chopra
354.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra said that 23-year-old Prithvi Shaw is a naturally destructive batter. "He (Shaw) is the guy who just takes off," Chopra said. "He is an absolute rocket, he simply flies. I am not saying he will fly in every match. [Jos] Buttler, [Alex] Hales or anyone else is also not seen flying in every match," he added.

355.title: Portugal captain Ronaldo lands in Qatar for FIFA World Cup amid controversy, pics surface
355.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo and his team members arriving at Hamad International Airport in Qatar's Doha ahead of FIFA World Cup 2022. Ronaldo has been involved in a controversy at Manchester United after he, in an interview, stated that he is being forced out of the club. As per reports, Manchester United will sue Ronaldo.

356.title: Man who killed partner in MP resort, shared video of body arrested
356.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police on Friday arrested the man who killed his partner in Jabalpur's Mekhala Resort from Rajasthan's Sirohi district. The accused, resident of Maharashtra, is a history-sheeter named in at least 37 cases in Nasik and Thane districts alone. The accused had posted videos of the victim lying dead in a room with a bedsheet covering her body.

357.title: Fabulous performances throughout: Sharath on Manika's bronze at Asian Cup
357.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal took to Twitter after compatriot Manika Batra became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal at Asian Cup and wrote, "Fabulous performances throughout. Many congratulations on winning a historical bronze medal." Former Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore tweeted, "Nation is proud of you. Best wishes for your future endeavours."

358.title: Employees union NITES writes to Labour Minister over Amazon layoffs
358.article_body: Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) has written a letter to Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav alleging that employees at Amazon in India are being forced to quit. As per the letter, Amazon has given a deadline to the employees until November 30 to complete the process. The letter added that Amazon has violated labour laws in the country.

359.title: Karthik was a specialist, he wasn't part of India XI in T20 WC semis: Parthiv
359.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India needs to identify their playing XI early in a World Cup year and stick with them till the tournament ends. "Dinesh Karthik was a specialist [in T20 World Cup 2022] and by the time...semi-finals came, he wasn't even part of...playing XI," he added. Karthik scored 14 runs in three innings in T20 World Cup 2022.

360.title: Kerala has become unsafe for women in last 6 years: Union Minister
360.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan claimed that Kerala has become unsafe for women in the last six years of the LDF-led government. "Two women were butchered recently. In Kochi, a woman was kidnapped and gang-raped. Such incidents bring shame to the state," he said. A woman was recently raped by three men in a car after she collapsed at a party.

361.title: Police question owner of Himachal guest house visited by Aftab, Shraddha
361.article_body: A three-member team of Delhi Police on Saturday questioned the owner of a guest house in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district where Shraddha Walkar and Aftab Poonawala stayed in April. Several police teams have reached Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh to question owners and staffers of hotels where the couple stayed. Aftab strangled his live-in partner Shraddha on May 18 in Delhi.

362.title: Nepal set for provisional and national elections on Sunday
362.article_body: Nepal will conduct provincial and national elections on Sunday. Over 17.9 million people are eligible to vote. The Federal Parliament has 275 seats, out of which 165 members are elected via direct voting and the rest via the proportional electoral system. The Provincial Assembly has 550 members, of which 330 are elected directly and the rest via the proportional method.

363.title: Ali Fazal to star in Anurag Basu's 'Life in a Metro 2': Reports
363.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu is reportedly working on the sequel to his 2007 film 'Life in a Metro'. "It's an ensemble cast film with...mix of familiar and new faces. Ali Fazal is already on board, while...casting of other leads is still in progress," a source was quoted as saying. The film is expected to go on floors in December, reports said.

364.title: Amit Shah to hold rallies in Guj's Tapi, Narmada ahead of Assembly polls
364.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday will hold two public rallies in Gujarat's Tapi and Narmada districts ahead of the Assembly elections. Shah is scheduled to hold meetings in Tapi's Nizar village at 2:30 pm and Narmada's Dediapada town at 4 pm. PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to hold rallies in Gujarat's Saurashtra from November 20 to November 22.

365.title: Man dies by suicide after losing Rae Bareli ZP chairperson election
365.article_body: A man who lost the Zilla Panchayat (ZP) Chairman election in Rae Bareli recently has died by suicide in Lucknow, police said. The deceased man had borrowed money to contest the election. Unable to clear the debt, he was hiding in Lucknow since October 31. The man had contested the election twice in six years and had lost both times.

366.title: Maharashtra govt to form squad for girls who elope: Minister Lodha
366.article_body: Maharashtra's Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Mangal Prabhat Lodha on Saturday said the government will set up a special squad to protect women who leave their parents' homes after a fight or elope with a partner. The decision comes in the wake of the Shraddha Walker murder case. Shraddha Walker was murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala.

367.title: 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar' for 2021-22 conferred to 39 schools
367.article_body: The Ministry of Education on Saturday conferred the national-level award under 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar 2021-22' to 39 schools from across the country. The schools selected from among the 8.23 lakh entries include 28 government and aided, while 11 are private schools. "Cash prizes of ₹60,000 to 34 schools (in overall category) and ₹20,000 (in sub-categories) were given," an official said.

368.title: Secularism, idea of India undermined in last 2 years: Chidambaram
368.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said all pillars of society, including political parties, are "gripped with fear" in the country. "Forces that are undermining the idea of India have been at work in the last 2-2.5 years," the former Union Minister said. He added that "the idea of India has been undermined" and secularism has been reduced to "embracing one religion".

369.title: Election symbols are not a party's exclusive property: Delhi HC
369.article_body: The Delhi High Court has said that political parties cannot consider election symbols as their "exclusive property". "The right to use the symbol can be lost with the dismal performance of the party," said the bench. The observations came while dismissing an appeal by Samata Party against the allotment of the 'flaming torch' symbol to the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena.

370.title: 'Prepared to walk away': EU on likelihood of a 'bad' COP27 deal
370.article_body: The EU warned on Saturday that it is "prepared to walk away" from the COP27 climate summit if negotiators fail to reach a suitable agreement on tackling the climate crisis. "We'd rather have no decision than a bad decision," the bloc's climate action chief Frans Timmermans said. "We believe that a positive result today is still within reach," he added.

371.title: God willing, I will fight next J&K Assembly polls: Farooq Abdullah
371.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday he will "Insha Allah" contest the next Assembly elections in the union territory. "Let them announce the dates, we will show them where they stand," Farooq said, referring to the BJP. Meanwhile, his son Omar Abdullah earlier said Farooq will not participate in the Jammu and Kashmir National Conference's next presidential elections.

372.title: World's most powerful telescope spots 'unusually bright' most distant galaxies
372.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope- the world's most powerful telescope, has spotted two "exceptionally bright" galaxies with "the most distant starlight that anyone had ever seen". "These two...galaxies could fundamentally alter what we know about the very first stars," said NASA, while releasing images. The galaxies existed approximately 450 and 350 million years after the big bang.

373.title: Honesty was premise of our relationship, that got eroded: Darshan on Akshay
373.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan, speaking about his equation with Akshay Kumar, said, "Honesty was the premise of my relationship with him, and somewhere, that got eroded." He added that the actor used to treat him like a guru. Suneel, who worked with Akshay in several films, further said he hasn't met the actor since the release of their 2005 film 'Dosti'.

374.title: Two arrested for bomb blast threat at Bharat Jodo Yatra in MP's Indore
374.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly threatening to blow up Khalsa Stadium in Madhya Pradesh's Indore during Bharat Jodo Yatra on November 28. Earlier this week, a letter threatening the bomb blast had come to light. It stated that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and the party's state unit chief Kamal Nath would be assassinated at the campaign's Indore halt.

375.title: India's target is to finish on podium of Hockey WC 2023: Midfielder Sumit
375.article_body: Indian men's hockey team midfielder Sumit said his side's target is to finish on the podium of next year's World Cup. "I still remember...2018 World Cup when we lost in the quarter-finals and every time I go back to Bhubaneswar, it reminds me of that loss," he added. World Cup will be played in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela, beginning January 13.

376.title: Centre using CBI, ED, I-T dept as 'Trishul' against non-BJP govts: CPI(M)
376.article_body: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat on Saturday accused the Centre of using ED, CBI and Income Tax Department as its 'Trishul' (trident) against governments of non-BJP parties in states. She said what Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren is facing is "not a question of one person, but it is an attack on constitutional place of Opposition in a democratic country".

377.title: Reaching T20 WC 2022 semi-finals can be considered an achievement: Ashwin
377.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign cannot be called "disappointing". He added, "We lost in the semi-finals. Reaching the semi-finals and finals can be considered an achievement. But from an Indian fan's point of view, and the expectations they have of this team, I totally understand the disappointment from the fans."

378.title: K'taka Congress files complaint with SEC over 'voter fraud' by BJP
378.article_body: Congress has filed a complaint with the Karnataka State Election Commission (SEC) against "electoral fraud" in the state, allegedly at the behest of CM Basavaraj Bommai. Congress has alleged that BJP minister CN Ashwath Narayan and his team stole voter data and deleted lakhs of votes. CM Bommai said he has ordered a probe into the matter.

379.title: No country alone can defeat borderless threat of terrorism: Shah
379.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said the international community must rise above "geo-political interests" against the "borderless threat" of terrorism. "In these terror havens, it's necessary to shackle their unrestrained activities along with economic crackdown," said Shah. Stating that no country can fight the threat alone, he added that some countries have made terrorism their state policy.

380.title: Federal Bank partners with JCB India to provide heavy equipment financing
380.article_body: Federal Bank announced on Friday that it has partnered with JCB India to expand its loan portfolio and fund potential buyers of heavy construction equipment. According to a statement by the lender, the partnership would increase the financing alternatives for JCB consumers in India. Under the arrangement, JCB's customers can avail loans from the lender at competitive interest rates.

381.title: It wasn't dad's decision: Jatin Pandit's son on split with Lalit Pandit
381.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit's son Raahul Jatin has said his father never wanted to split with his long-time collaborator and brother Lalit Pandit. "It was never dad's decision and we're still waiting on uncle," he added. Raahul added that Jatin was "really bummed out" after splitting with Lalit. Jatin and Lalit parted ways after working on the 2006 film 'Fanaa'.

382.title: SRK recommended me for Dil Se, Mani said 'can't have 2 similar actresses': Divya
382.article_body: Divya Dutta revealed that Shah Rukh Khan had recommended her name to director Mani Ratnam for his 1998 film 'Dil Se'. She added on his recommendation, Mani messaged her, saying he won't be able to cast her as she looks "similar" to lead actress Manisha Koirala. She recalled the filmmaker saying, "I can't have two similar actresses in one film."

383.title: T'gana Cong expels Shashidhar Reddy for 6 yrs over 'anti-party activities'
383.article_body: Telangana Congress on Saturday expelled senior party leader M Shashidhar Reddy for a period of six years over "anti-party activities". The action against Reddy came after his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar. Reddy also allegedly passed several comments against TPCC President Revanth Reddy and his style of functioning.

384.title: India planning to showcase Nagaland’s Hornbill Festival at G20
384.article_body: India is planning to showcase Nagaland's Hornbill Festival after it assumes the presidency of G20 on December 1. G20 Chief Coordinator Harsh Vardhan Shringla recently discussed the opportunities to showcase the festival with Nagaland CM Neiphu Rio. "India's G20 is an opportunity for the state of Nagaland to showcase its cultural diversity, uniqueness and tourism potential," Shringla said.

385.title: Russia trying to exhaust Kyiv's air defence supplies: Pentagon official
385.article_body: The recent surge in Russia's missile strikes in Ukraine is partly aimed at exhausting Kyiv's air defence supplies to clear the path for the domination of Ukraine's skies, the Pentagon's top policy advisor has said. "We're committed to making sure...that the Ukrainians get what they need to keep their air defences viable," Colin Kahl told reporters on Saturday.

386.title: Case filed against AMU student who was attacked during cricket match
386.article_body: A countercase has been registered against the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) student who was allegedly hit on the head during a cricket match. The case has been filed following a report by the accused's father and the insistence of BJP MLC Manvendra Pratap Singh. The victim, Sajid Husain, was hit on the head by fellow second-year student Shobhit Singh.

387.title: Gem, jewellery exports fell 15% to ₹25,844 crore in Oct: Data
387.article_body: The gem and jewellery exports declined 14.64% year-over-year in October at ₹25,843.84 crore as against ₹30,274.64 crore from the year-ago period, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said. The decline in exports in October or November is a seasonal trend as manufacturing activities are either limited or units are closed because of Diwali, GJEPC stated.

388.title: Playing T10 league has helped improve my game against spin: Hales
388.article_body: England batter Alex Hales said that playing Abu Dhabi T10 has definitely helped him in improving his batting against spin bowling. "It's still an area (spin) that I'm looking to get better at, so I'll be sure to...top up as much as I can," Hales said. He added that he is pretty familiar with what to expect in UAE conditions.

389.title: Haryana village gifts SUV, ₹2 crore to defeated Sarpanch candidate
389.article_body: To avoid bitterness, residents of Chiri village in Haryana gifted an SUV car and ₹2.11 crore to a candidate who lost the Sarpanch elections on November 12. Dharmpal Dalal alias Kala, who was overwhelmed by the gesture, said, "I'll contribute to the village welfare activities like before after today's gesture." He lost the elections to Naveen Dalal by 66 votes.

390.title: 2 injured as autorickshaw explodes in Mangaluru, police say 'remain calm'
390.article_body: An autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. "They are undergoing treatment and are unable to speak now. We request the public not to spread rumours. They should remain calm and not panic," Mangaluru City Police Commissioner N Shashi Kumar said. "The driver alleged he spotted the fire," he added.

391.title: 'Can't take Indian photos due to lighting' sign at Australian post office sparks row
391.article_body: A sign that said "Due to our lighting and quality of photo background, we, unfortunately, CAN NOT take INDIAN photos" was seen at a post office in Adelaide city of South Australia, sparking criticism. A picture of the sign was posted on Twitter, following which Australia Post said, "We're sincerely sorry for the offence caused by this unauthorised sign."

392.title: Activist Navlakha released from jail, to be put under house arrest
392.article_body: Activist Gautam Navlakha, accused in the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case, was released from Taloja jail and handed over to Navi Mumbai Police for house arrest on Saturday. This comes after the Supreme Court on Thursday allowed Navlakha to be shifted to house arrest for a month. Navlakha had approached the SC saying that he was suffering from health issues.

393.title: Centre to spend ₹50,000 cr on infrastructural development of Arunachal: PM
393.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said the Centre is going to spend ₹50,000 crore in near future for the infrastructural development of Arunachal Pradesh. PM Modi, who inaugurated the Donyi Polo Airport at Hollongi, said that the state has great potential for tourism. With the development of the new airport, farmers can sell their produce to bigger markets, he added.

394.title: 8, including 3 women, injured in ordnance factory explosion in TN
394.article_body: Eight persons, including three women, were injured in an explosion at an ordnance factory near Coonoor in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris on Saturday, an official said. The explosion occurred at 8:20 am in the cordite section, the factory's Deputy General Manager T Sanker said. Since workers weren't present in the section during the explosion, there were no grievous injuries, he added.

395.title: Air India in talks with Airbus, Boeing for 'historic order': CEO Wilson
395.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft, the airline's CEO Campbell Wilson said. "We're in deep discussion with Boeing, Airbus...for a historic order of the latest generation aircraft that will power Air India's medium- and long-term growth," he added. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes.

396.title: Loco pilot, his assistant run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in J'khand
396.article_body: A loco pilot and his assistant were killed after they were run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in Jharkhand, a Railways official said on Saturday. The incident took place when the duo, posted at Chakradharpur, was changing the engine of a goods train. The passenger train was going through an adjacent line, the official added.

397.title: Rohit, Rahul, Kohli are on wrong side of 30s: Aakash on top 3 in T20Is
397.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said some adjustments need to be made in India's top three in T20Is considering the next T20 World Cup in 2024. He added that Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli are on the wrong side of thirties. While Rohit and Kohli are 35 and 34 years old respectively, Rahul turned 30 in April this year.

398.title: Tesla recalls 3,21,000 vehicles in US over rear light issue
398.article_body: Tesla is recalling more than 3,21,000 vehicles in US because one or both tail lights may intermittently fail to illuminate, according to a filing with US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The Texas-based EV maker said the recall affects some 2023 Model 3 and 2020-2023 Model Y vehicles. Tesla will deploy an over-the-air update to correct the issue.

399.title: Shivaji an old idol, find new ones like Nitin Gadkari: Maha Governor
399.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari faced criticism from Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena on Saturday for calling Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol'. "You can find new (idols), from Babasaheb Ambedkar to Nitin Gadkari," he said. "Shivaji...is not only our deity but our source of inspiration. He will always be the idol for...us," a spokesman from Uddhav's Shiv Sena said.

400.title: UP Police cancels leaves of all its personnel in view of polls
400.article_body: UP Police has cancelled the leaves of all of its personnel in view of the upcoming parliamentary and Assembly by-polls, and local body elections. A directive issued in this regard on Saturday said the leaves had been cancelled with immediate effect till the completion of the election process. Concerned officers, however, have been authorised to grant leaves in special cases.

401.title: Women can fulfil dreams post marriage: BJP Guj candidate Rivaba Jadeja
401.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba, who's a BJP candidate in Gujarat Assembly elections, said on Saturday, "I want to inspire couples that women can fulfil their dreams after marriage." Praising Ravindra for supporting her, she said, "My husband is like a booster dose for me." Rivaba added, "It's...important that behind the success of every woman, there's her husband and brother."

402.title: Radisson Blu Ghaziabad owner Amit Jain found dead at Delhi flat
402.article_body: Amit Jain, the owner of Radisson Blu hotel in UP's Ghaziabad has been found dead, reports said on Saturday. Jain's body was found hanging at his residential flat in Delhi's Khel Gaon and suicide is suspected, police said. His body has reportedly been sent for post-mortem. As per reports, Jain was distressed due to business losses.

403.title: Retired IAS officer Arun Goel appointed Election Commissioner
403.article_body: Retired bureaucrat Arun Goel was on Saturday appointed Election Commissioner in the Election Commission of India (ECI), the Law and Justice Ministry said. The 1985 batch ex-IAS officer was appointed to the post of the third Election Commissioner. The post was vacant after the then-Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar took the charge as the Chief Election Commissioner in May this year.
